Articles.Content:
Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, kerbals of all ages! Step right up and see the spectacle of Jebadiah as he attempts the new water speed record in a game currently lacking fluid dynamics!

The challenge: To, on water, get as fast as possible

Conditions:

-NO MECHJEB

-No part mods apart from Spaceplane plus (As it is integrated into .25)

-The "boat" must remain fully intact

-The "boat" must be able to come to a complete stop after it has reached its top speed

-Mods such as Engineer are fine

-You may use any propulsion system you like

-No submarines - that's just cheating!

-The vehicle MUST CONTAIN CREW

Screenshots as proof please!

There are two winners:

[EASY] Stock champion: Nobody

[HARD] FAR champion : Brainiacblue with 284.2m/s

Edited August 30, 2014 by BrainiacBlue
Maybe you should post your own attempt to encourage other people to participate here. I think it's not easy to build a fast water.. rocket.

So - I will get the ball rolling:

This took 4 tries before I was finally able to stop at this speed without it nosediving and killing Jeb. As you can see I managed an incredible 284.2m/s. Beat that Scott and/or Danny!

Edited August 30, 2014 by BrainiacBlue

From a previous challenge: Sped Boat Mark I. All stock.

Tops out around 320 m/s. Not useful for actually going anywhere. All the relevant design features are in the screenshot.

That is certainly an interesting design but it doesn't carry crew. But a seat on the top would do the trick so... post something with a seat on it and I'll give you the stock record. FAR is so much harder - The boat generates lift and likes to bounce around a lot. I really want this to be a Scott Manley challenge. He'd probably end up making a 600m/s thing with FAR enabled and capable of carrying 15 kerbals.

Bumping this for myself. I used to be super into boats, doing a Kerbal Regatta challenge and attempting a boat trip around the world, but I haven't played in a few months and I'm a bit behind in updates. I'll definitely give this one a go. I really want to get back into boating in KSP. :3

This is my first successful speedboat from I think about a year ago, the Waterbug.

This isn't much of a record, but it'll help fill up your lonely list:

Here, have an imgur album:
